Description: MGP Ingredients of Illinois, Inc. (MGP)--an ethanol producing company--reached a settlement to resolve claims that it violated the Clean Air Act by spending about $1.5 million on pollution controls and paying an $85,900 penalty to the federal government.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division

Description: MGP Ingredients of Illinois, formerly known as Midwest Grain Products, agreed to pay $300,000 to the Illnois Environmental Protection Agency's Special Projects Fund and $200,000 to the Illinois Environmental Protection Trust Fund in settlement of allegations it failed to keep emissions of particulate matter within permitted levels.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20071020214318/http://www.illinoisattorneygeneral.gov/pressroom/2006_11/20061128.html

Description: MGP Ingredients of Illinois, Inc. agreed to pay $85,900 each to the United States and the State of Illinois, and install air pollution control equipment with and estimated cost of $1-2 million, in settlement of allegations it violated the Clean Air Act. The case was also announced by the Justice Department; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-mgp-ingredients-of-illinois-inc
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20060220211721/http://www.usdoj.gov/opa/pr/2005/December/05_enrd_689.html
